value.title: Dynamic titles with multiple slicers or filters in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've talked about dynamic titles in Power BI before. But, what if you wanted to combine multiple values into that dynamic title. Patrick shows you how using a little DAX!  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/dynamictitlesample  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Power BI on a Mac?
value.excerpt: Want to run Power BI on a mac? We look at what your options are to get Power BI Desktop running on your mac. You have a few choices.  Ideas: Power BI Designer for Mac https://ideas.powerbi.com/forums/265200-power-bi-ideas/suggestions/7546645-power-bi-designer-for-mac   Apple Boot Camp https://support.apple.com/boot-camp

value.title: Power BI report page tooltip - How to create one in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Patrick walks through what a Power BI report page tooltip is and how to create one in Power BI Desktop. This is a feature that was added to Power BI Desktop in the March 2018 release.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Dynamically Filter By Today's Date
value.excerpt: In this Power BI Tutorial, Patrick looks at how to dynamically filter by today's date. Using a date table, you can create a DAX measure that can then be used as a Power BI report-level filter to dynamically filter by today's date within Power BI Desktop.be  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

value.title: Advanced Concatenate/ Merge columns with Power Query
value.excerpt: Concatenating columns in Power Query is not hard to do, but depending on the technique you use, you might get unexpected or wrong results.  There is a bullet proof way to do it and I will explain it here.  00:00 Intro & Problem description 01:19 How power query concatenates columns with Table.CombineColumns

value.title: Building relationships between tables when both have duplicates
value.excerpt: PowerPivot and Power BI Desktop only allow the creation of relationships between tables when one of columns forming the relationship does not have duplicate values.
